get.description:
Returns a paginated list of repositories for the specified provider service and owner username

Optionally filterable by:
* a list of repository `name`s
* a `search` term which matches against the name
* whether the repository is `active` or not

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: whether the repository has received an upload

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.description:
Returns a comparison for either a pair of commits or a pull
Will only return pre-computed impacted files comparisons if available
If unavailable `files` will be empty, however once the computation is ready
the files will appear on subsequent calls
`state: "processed"` means `files` are finished computing and returned
`state: "pending"` means `files` are still computing, poll again later

parameters.name: pullid
parameters.description: pull ID on which to perform the comparison (alternative to specifying `base` and `head`)

get.description: Returns a list of components for the specified repository

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: branch name for which to return components (of head commit)

parameters.name: sha
parameters.description: commit SHA for which to return components

upload_token.title: token used for uploading coverage reports for this repo

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of timeseries measurements aggregated by the specified
`interval`.  If there are no measurements on `start_date` then the response will include
1 measurement older than `start_date` so that the coverage value can be carried forward
if necessary.

Optionally filterable by:
* `branch`
* `start_date`
* `end_date`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

timestamp.title: timestamp at the start of the interval

get.description:
Similar to the coverage report endpoint but only returns coverage info for a single
file specified by `path`.

By default that commit is the head of the default branch but can also be specified explictily by:
* `sha` - return report for the commit with the given SHA
* `branch` - return report for the head commit of the branch with the given name

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: branch name for which to return report (of head commit)

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: the file path for which to retrieve coverage info

parameters.name: sha
parameters.description: commit SHA for which to return report

commit_sha.title: commit SHA of the commit for which coverage info was found

commit_file_url.title: Codecov URL to see file coverage on commit.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: only return pulls with updatestamp on or after this date

get.description:
Similar to the coverage totals endpoint but also returns line-by-line
coverage info (hit=0/miss=1/partial=2).

By default that commit is the head of the default branch but can also be specified explictily by:
* `sha` - return report for the commit with the given SHA
* `branch` - return report for the head commit of the branch with the given name

The report can be optionally filtered by specifying:
* `path` - only show report info for pathnames that start with this value
* `flag` - only show report info that applies to the specified flag name
* `component_id` - only show report info that applies to the specified component

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: branch name for which to return report (of head commit)

parameters.name: component_id
parameters.description: filter report to only include info pertaining to given component id

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: filter report to only include info pertaining to given flag name

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: filter report to only include file paths starting with this value

parameters.name: sha
parameters.description: commit SHA for which to return report

commit_file_url.title: Codecov url to see file coverage on commit. Can be unreliable with partial path names.

get.description:
Returns a hierarchical view of the report that matches the file structure of the covered files
with coverage info rollups at each level.

Returns only top-level data by default but the depth of the traversal can be controlled via
the `depth` parameter.

* `depth` - how deep in the tree to traverse (default=1)
* `path` - path in the tree from which to start the traversal (default is the root)

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: branch name for which to return report (of head commit)

parameters.name: component_id
parameters.description: filter report to only include info pertaining to given component id

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: filter report to only include info pertaining to given flag name

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: starting path of the traversal (default is root path)

parameters.name: sha
parameters.description: commit SHA for which to return report

get.description: Returns a list of test results for the specified repository and commit

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Branch name for which to return test results

parameters.name: commit_id
parameters.description: Commit SHA for which to return test results

parameters.name: duration_max
parameters.description: Maximum duration of the test in seconds

parameters.name: duration_min
parameters.description: Minimum duration of the test in seconds

parameters.name: outcome
parameters.description: Status of the test (failure, skip, error, pass)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

get.description: Returns a single test result by ID

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Branch name for which to return test results

parameters.name: commit_id
parameters.description: Commit SHA for which to return test results

parameters.name: duration_max
parameters.description: Maximum duration of the test in seconds

parameters.name: duration_min
parameters.description: Minimum duration of the test in seconds

parameters.name: outcome
parameters.description: Status of the test (failure, skip, error, pass)

get.description:
Returns the coverage totals for a given commit and the
coverage totals broken down by file.

By default that commit is the head of the default branch but can also be specified explictily by:
* `sha` - return totals for the commit with the given SHA
* `branch` - return totals for the head commit of the branch with the given name

The totals can be optionally filtered by specifying:
* `path` - only show totals for pathnames that start with this value
* `flag` - only show totals that applies to the specified flag name
* `component_id` - only show totals that applies to the specified component

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: branch name for which to return report (of head commit)

parameters.name: component_id
parameters.description: filter report to only include info pertaining to given component id

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: filter report to only include info pertaining to given flag name

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: filter report to only include file paths starting with this value

parameters.name: sha
parameters.description: commit SHA for which to return report

commit_file_url.title: Codecov url to see file coverage on commit. Can be unreliable with partial path names.
